TryHackMe Room Walkthrough: Upload Vulnerabilities

Dec 28, 2021

Things inside ticks look like code

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Task 1:

In Task 1, you will deploy the vulnerable machine and then edit the hosts file on your system or attack box.

Linux/Mac OS:

Enter the following command in a terminal to update your hosts file with a new entry, allowing the urls used throughout the room to resolve to the correct ip address: echo "10.10.47.131 overwrite.uploadvulns.thm shell.uploadvulns.thm java.uploadvulns.thm annex.uploadvulns.thm magic.uploadvulns.thm jewel.uploadvulns.thm demo.uploadvulns.thm" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

Enter the following command to return your hosts file to normal: sudo sed -i '$d' /etc/hosts

Windows OS:

Enter the following command in Powershell: AC C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts "10.10.47.131 overwrite.uploadvulns.thm shell.uploadvulns.thm java.uploadvulns.thm annex.uploadvulns.thm magic.uploadvulns.thm jewel.uploadvulns.thm demo.uploadvulns.thm"

Enter the following command to return your hosts file to normal: (GC C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts | select -Skiplast 1) | SC C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts##

Task 2,3:

Read through the introduction and background info, and install gobuster if needed.

Task 4:
